Notification Body: Make smart choices off the menu. Focus on fresh foods and avoid fried ones. Your body will thank you.
Don't feel pressured to finish a dish if you're full. Pack it up and save it for later.
Veggies are the way to go! Save on calories by swapping out carbs for a fresh vegetable dish.
Be cautious with salads. They can be healthy, but look out for dressings, cheeses, & fried toppings that are high in calories.

CTA: Use lemon and vinegar for flavor
Notification Body: Salt may enhance your food but it’s not the healthiest option. Trade it in for fresh lemon and vinegar for flavor.
Avoid spikes in your blood sugar by having fiber-friendly foods at the beginning of the meal.

CTA: Place shared dishes on a plate
Notification Body: When sharing dishes, always place your food on a plate. It’ll help you be mindful of your portions.
Don’t be shy, you can always ask to modify your dish when eating out. Put dressings on the side, or say no to butter & oil.
Look out for lean sources of protein off a menu such as boneless chicken, turkey, or fatty fish like salmon.
Fill up on veggies. Keep an eye out for plant-based foods. They aren’t just trendy, they can be super healthy too.

CTA: Read food labels carefully to choose healthy options
Notification Body: Food labels can be tricky. Keep an eye out for products low in sugar, saturated fat & salts.

CTA: Stock your pantry with these healthy items to make meal prep easier
Notification Body: Keeping your pantry stocked with healthy items is easier than you think! Grains, beans & nuts will set you up for healthy meals.

CTA: Plan your meals ahead of time to avoid unhealthy food choices
Notification Body: Meal planning is everything! Try to plan dinners ahead to avoid last-minute fast foods.

CTA: Check the ingredients in your food to make sure they're healthy
Notification Body: Read the facts on your food! As a rule of thumb - the fewer the ingredients the better.

CTA: Look for healthy food options around the perimeter of the store
Notification Body: Did you ever notice that healthier food options are found around the perimeter of shops? Stick to the healthy area.

CTA: Add nuts to your fruit to balance your blood sugar
Notification Body: Avoid the usual blood sugar spike by adding a handful of nuts to your meal.

CTA: Choose lean meat and fish for protein and omega-3s
Notification Body: Lean meat or fish are actually low in carbs & can be the source of your protein and omega-3’s.

CTA: Choose whole grains for complex carbs
Notification Body: Whole grains are the real deal. Stock up on quinoa, brown rice and oats to add complex carbs to any meal.

CTA: Plan your meals ahead of time to reduce stress and eat healthily
Notification Body: Map out your weekly menu. Plan your meals ahead of time to avoid stress while following a healthy diet.

CTA: Choose colorful fruits and vegetables for a balanced diet
Notification Body: Plan your meals accordingly. Choose colorful fruits and veggies to balance your nutrients.

Add some stretches into your day, it’s good for both your physical and mental health.
